p: In the present study, we used the mitochondrial cytb gene to characterize the intraspecific genetic diversity of P. guyannensis and P. cuvieri in the eastern portion of the Guiana region. Cytb has been widely used in studies of genetic variability and phylogenetics of small mammals [ 38, 39]. Although mutation rate is high in mitochondrial DNA, it is a largely useful molecular tool for the reconstruction of the history of populations and species due to its relatively simple amplification, typically non-recombinant haploids, and its high degree of intra and interspecific variability [ 40, 41].
